comments.author: nicolas.barbulesco@supinfo.com
comments.text:
Data loss.
Bug encountered in Firefox 4.0.1 on Win Vista and in Firefox 6.0 on Mac OS X 10.6.8.
See screen film :
http://screencast.com/t/geeiuW6Efxq
At the page :
http://fr.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ladislas_Ier_de_Pologne&action=edit&oldid=69533658
I select the text " de Pologne", with the space at the beginning because I need the space. I drag-and-drop it in the text area.
The space has been lost.
This is incorrect.
In Safari on my Mac, the behaviour is correct : I have the space.

Thanks for correcting that.

Nicolas
comments.creator: nicolas.barbulesco@supinfo.com

Confirmed on Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:9.0a1) Gecko/20110912 Firefox/9.0a1 ID:20110912030829

Dragging to a regular text box appears to work - moving to Core -> Editor
comments.text:
Confirmed on Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:9.0a1) Gecko/20110912 Firefox/9.0a1 ID:20110912030829

Dragging to a regular text box appears to work - moving to Core -> Editor
comments.author: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.creator: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com

comments.text:
I am now using Firefox 3.0.1 on Windows :

Dragging to an "input" text field, like the Wikipedia summary field, keeps the space. Correct behaviour.
Dragging to the text area keeps the space. Correct behaviour.

So the bug we encounter in more recent Firefoxes is a regression.
comments.author: nicolas.barbulesco@supinfo.com
comments.creator: nicolas.barbulesco@supinfo.com
comments.raw_text:
I am now using Firefox 3.0.1 on Windows :

Dragging to an "input" text field, like the Wikipedia summary field, keeps the space. Correct behaviour.
Dragging to the text area keeps the space. Correct behaviour.

So the bug we encounter in more recent Firefoxes is a regression.

With Firefox 6.0 on Mac OS X 10.6.8 :

Alas, dragging to an "input" text field, like the Wikipedia summary field, loses the space. Incorrect behaviour.

With Firefox 4.0.1 on Win Vista :

Alas, dragging to an "input" text field, like the Wikipedia summary field, loses the space. Incorrect behaviour.
comments.creator: nicolas.barbulesco@supinfo.com
